title: Introduction to Physical AI & Humanoid Robotics

modules.name: Introduction to Physical AI
modules.description: Basic concepts of Physical AI and its applications in robotics

chapters.name: Physical AI Fundamentals
chapters.content:
# Physical AI Fundamentals

Physical AI is an interdisciplinary field that combines artificial intelligence with physical systems. This chapter introduces the core concepts, historical context, and applications of Physical AI in robotics.

## Key Concepts
- Embodied Cognition
- Sensorimotor Learning
- Real-world Interaction
- Adaptive Control Systems

## Applications
Physical AI has applications in various domains including humanoid robotics, autonomous vehicles, and smart manufacturing.

learningObjectives.description: Define Physical AI and distinguish it from traditional AI approaches
Identify key applications of Physical AI in robotics and automation

exercises.title: Physical AI Conceptual Questions
exercises.description: Answer the following questions about Physical AI concepts to test your understanding.
exercises.solution: Solutions would include detailed explanations of Physical AI concepts and their applications.

questions.question: What distinguishes Physical AI from traditional AI approaches?
options: Physical AI operates in real-world environments with physical systems
Physical AI uses more sophisticated algorithms
Physical AI requires more computational power
Physical AI is just a marketing term
questions.correctAnswer: Physical AI operates in real-world environments with physical systems
questions.explanation: Physical AI specifically deals with AI systems that interact with the physical world, as opposed to traditional AI which often operates on abstract data.

modules.name: Humanoid Robotics Basics
modules.description: Fundamentals of humanoid robot design, control, and applications

chapters.name: Humanoid Robot Design Principles
chapters.content:
# Humanoid Robot Design Principles

Humanoid robots are designed to resemble and mimic human behavior. This chapter explores the principles behind their design, mechanical systems, and control mechanisms.

## Key Design Considerations
- Biomechanical Accuracy
- Degrees of Freedom
- Balance and Locomotion
- Human-Robot Interaction

## Mechanical Systems
Humanoid robots require sophisticated mechanical systems including actuators, sensors, and structural components that mimic human capabilities.

learningObjectives.description: Explain the key design principles behind humanoid robots
Analyze the mechanical systems required for humanoid robot functionality

exercises.title: Humanoid Design Analysis
exercises.description: Analyze the design of a humanoid robot and identify the key components that enable human-like movement.
exercises.solution: Analysis would include examination of joint configurations, actuator types, sensor placement, and control algorithms.

questions.question: What is the primary characteristic that defines a humanoid robot?
options: Ability to walk on two legs
questions.explanation: Humanoid robots are defined by their human-like appearance and behavior, including bipedal locomotion and human-like interaction capabilities.
